* Experience in DFMA principles toward the design of electro-mechanical products

* Experience project managing pilot runs of new product development in support of new product introduction

* Project Management experience is a plus but not required

Position Overview

The End User Technology (EUT) Virtualization Team is part of MetLife's Enterprise Infrastructure Engineering organization, supporting global end-user virtual computing platforms. This team is responsible for designing, implementing, and managing virtualization solutions that enable secure, scalable, and high-performance virtual desktop environments. Leveraging technologies such as Citrix, VDI, Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD), Windows 365, Intune and Ivanti, the team ensures seamless access to applications and desktops for employees worldwide, driving productivity and operational efficiency.

The Opportunity

The Senior Engineer - EUT Virtualization is responsible for designing, implementing, and managing enterprise-scale virtualization solutions that enable secure and seamless end-user experiences across MetLife's global operations. This position is critical to ensuring employees have reliable access to virtual desktops and applications, supporting productivity and business continuity worldwide.

This is an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies such as Citrix, Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD), Windows 365, and Microsoft Intune, driving innovation in end-user computing. You'll play a key role in shaping MetLife's virtualization strategy, optimizing performance, and delivering secure solutions that empower thousands of employees.

Success in this role requires deep technical expertise in virtualization platforms and strong problem-solving skills. The Senior Engineer is responsible for architecting and maintaining virtual desktop environments and ensuring compliance with security standards. You'll collaborate closely with cloud engineering, security, and end-user technology teams in an environment where every contribution is respected, and every perspective is heard.
